poem:
### Denim Dreams

In denim's weave, history hums,  
blue threads of prairie tongues.  
Texan tales stitched in seams,  
from saddle to saloon they glide.  
Faded knees like old maps,  
creased by hooves and heat.  
Age, an echo in each thread,  
riding bulls, binding time—  
as if jeans are lines of verse,  
telling tales between the fray.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Jeans are, and were, working clothes. In the right pair, you can rope a calf, ride a bull or attend a barbecue. They". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
